oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Spanish War daughters feted, from the Nashville Times, 1940
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A captioned photo from the Nashville Times (1940), about a banquet related to Spanish-American War veterans. The caption reads: “As a preliminary event for today’s reunion of Spanish-American War veterans, the above group of Spanish Daughters were given a banquet last night at Shacklett’s Cafeteria. Reading, left to right above, are Olleen Greer, Margaret Whetstone, Ann Elizabeth Long, Mary Cravens, of Memphis, Norma Dunn, Ethylin Murphy, Tillie Howard, Elsie? H. Newell, Cliffie May Kinnard, Mildred Chumbley, Frances Garrett, Eunice Caldwell, Helen Craver, Mrs. Margaret Whetstone, Esther Murphy, and Arizona Greer.” Forms part of the Nashville Times newspaper collection. 1 digital photo.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Spanish-American War Veterans--History--Sources; Schacklett’s Cafeteria (Nashville, Tenn.)
